name: JPEG XL image format
description: A modern image format optimized for web environments. JPEG XL generally has better compression than [WebP](/webp), JPEG, PNG and GIF and is designed to supersede them. JPEG XL competes with [AVIF](/avif) which has similar compression quality but fewer features overall.

links.title: Request for Mozilla position on JPEG XL
2024 update on the request for Mozilla position on JPEG XL
JPEG-XL Image Support Returns To Latest Chrome / Chromium Code

byNum.1: Can be enabled via the `enable-jxl` flag.
byNum.2: Can be enabled via the `image.jxl.enabled` flag in `about:config` in Nightly only. This flag is configurable but has no effect in the other builds.
byNum.3: Can be enabled via the `--enable-features=JXL` runtime flag.
byNum.4: Supports still images. Animated image sequences are not supported.
byNum.5: Partial support refers to not supporting progressive decoding.
